page.title: 15TRADE
page.content: GARAGES Skidlows and Fallons{garages}are both situated on a main road. Both are { {fuel stations}and are{engine}and{body {repairers.}Skidlows garage has been there 24 years whereas Fallons has only existed 15 years. Fallons garage is also a{car showroom}selling Colt cars. It also has a self contained small shop which has for sale sweets, toys, cassette tapes and video tapes. Both garages offer four fuel pumps. At Fallons 65 000 litres of petrol is delivered every week, compared with 4 000 litres at Skidlows. Skidlows garage have assistants to fill customer's petrol tanks, but Fallons petrol sales are all self-service. Both service stations charge the price of Â£2.01 per gallon of four star petrol (27th June 1985).
